page.title: 04Garvald Flora
page.content: Garvald is never without wild flowers: first the white drift of snowdrops under the willow catkins and the pink larch cones. Early spring brings primroses, butterburr, wood anemones, violets, moschatel, meadow & golden saxifrage - both opposite and alternative leaved. Then comes the angelica, pink campion beneath sloe & may blossom, followed by buttercups, marsh marigolds, sanicle, wood avens,cranesbill and many others. In Summer mimulus, meadowsweet, valerian, willowherbs, ragged robin, iris, marsh cinquefoil, and stonecrop in the wetlands; stitchworts, bladder campion foxgloves, scabious, dactyloahiza orchids, trefoils & vetches & great bellflower. In the moor grass, thyme, speedwells, milkwort, bedstraws, eyebright and harebells can be found.
